did.abstract: Principally the Civil War letters of the four sons of Captain James O. Coghill, all members of the 23rd North Carolina Infantry Regiment, C.S.A., describing military activities in Virginia, Maryland and Pennsylvania; sickness in the army; and aid to the soldiers of the 23rd Regiment from their families in North Carolina. Included are frequent references to other members of the 23rd Regiment.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: James O. Coghill was a farmer, resident of Henderson (Granville Co.), N.C., and a malitiaman.
